trans-unit.source: How to Use the Console Pane in the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Console Pane in the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: How to Use the Console Pane in the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Console Pane in the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: The Console pane in the Windows PowerShell® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) operates exactly like the stand-alone Windows PowerShell ISE console window.
trans-unit.target: The Console pane in the Windows PowerShell® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) operates exactly like the stand-alone Windows PowerShell ISE console window.

trans-unit.source: To run a command in the Console Pane, type a command, and then press ENTER.
trans-unit.target: To run a command in the Console Pane, type a command, and then press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: To enter multiple commands that you want to execute in sequence, type SHIFT+ENTER between commands.
trans-unit.target: To enter multiple commands that you want to execute in sequence, type SHIFT+ENTER between commands.

trans-unit.source: See [How to Use Tab Completion in the Script Pane and Console Pane](How-to-Use-Tab-Completion-in-the-Script-Pane-and-Console-Pane.md) for help in typing commands.
trans-unit.target: See [How to Use Tab Completion in the Script Pane and Console Pane](How-to-Use-Tab-Completion-in-the-Script-Pane-and-Console-Pane.md) for help in typing commands.

trans-unit.source: To stop a command, on the toolbar, click **Stop Operation**, or press CTRL+BREAK.
trans-unit.target: To stop a command, on the toolbar, click **Stop Operation**, or press CTRL+BREAK.

trans-unit.source: You can also use CTRL+C to stop a command if the context is unambiguous.
trans-unit.target: You can also use CTRL+C to stop a command if the context is unambiguous.

trans-unit.source: For example, if some text has been selected in the current Pane, then CTRL+C maps to the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: For example, if some text has been selected in the current Pane, then CTRL+C maps to the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Beginning in Windows PowerShell v3, the Output pane was combined with the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Beginning in Windows PowerShell v3, the Output pane was combined with the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: This has the benefit of behaving like the stand-alone Windows PowerShell console and eliminates the differences in procedures that were needed when they were separate.
trans-unit.target: This has the benefit of behaving like the stand-alone Windows PowerShell console and eliminates the differences in procedures that were needed when they were separate.

trans-unit.source: You can:
trans-unit.target: You can:

trans-unit.source: Select and copy text from the Console pane to the Clipboard for pasting in any other window.
trans-unit.target: Select and copy text from the Console pane to the Clipboard for pasting in any other window.

trans-unit.source: To select text, click and hold the mouse in the output pane while dragging the mouse over the text you want to capture.
trans-unit.target: To select text, click and hold the mouse in the output pane while dragging the mouse over the text you want to capture.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the cursor arrow keys while holding **SHIFT** to select text.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the cursor arrow keys while holding **SHIFT** to select text.

trans-unit.source: Then press CTRL+C or click the **Copy** icon in the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Then press CTRL+C or click the **Copy** icon in the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Paste the selected text at a current cursor position.
trans-unit.target: Paste the selected text at a current cursor position.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Paste** icon on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Paste** icon on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Clear all the text in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Clear all the text in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: To clear the Console pane, you can click the **Clear Console Pane** icon on the toolbar, or run the command **Clear-Host** or its alias, **cls**.
trans-unit.target: To clear the Console pane, you can click the **Clear Console Pane** icon on the toolbar, or run the command **Clear-Host** or its alias, **cls**.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: [Using the Windows PowerShell ISE](Using-the-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md)
trans-unit.target: [Using the Windows PowerShell ISE](Using-the-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md)
